contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=February 2007}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = Tin Foil Phoenix |background = group_or_band |alias = |origin = [[Winnipeg, Manitoba]], [[Canada]] |genre = [[Post-grunge]], [[alternative rock]] |years_active = 1997–present |label = [[C4 Records|C4]]<br/>[[604 Records|604]]<br/>[[Roadrunner Records|Roadrunner]] |website = [http://www.tinfoilphoenix.com/ TinFoilPhoenix.com] |current_members = Michael Allen Zirk<br />Lyle Geisbrecht<br />Fish<br />Yves Gagnon <br />Phil Cholosky |past_members = Stephan Kray<br>Paul Robinson }} '''Tin Foil Phoenix''' is a [[Canadian]] [[post-grunge]] band from [[Winnipeg]]. The band formed from the ashes of a previous incarnation under the moniker of Sonic Bloom with core members Michael Allen Zirk and Steven Kray. Guitarist Fish joined soon thereafter.<ref name="therise">{{cite web | url = http://www.viewmag.com/viewstory.php?storyid=2504 | title = The Rise of the Phoenix | author = Peter Klassen | publisher = View Magazine | accessdate = 2006-03-07}}</ref> Bassist Paul Robinson joined the band in 1999 and two years later, they added another guitarist, Phil Cholosky. In 2001, they released ''[[Hurry (EP)|Hurry]]'', an independent seven-song EP. Its first single, ''Neopolitan'', got a great amount of airplay on Canadian [[radio]].<ref name="littleshop">{{cite web | url = http://www.uptownmag.com/archive/music/04sept09.htm | title = Little shop of horrors | author = Mike Warkentin | publisher = Uptown Magazine | accessdate = 2007-03-07 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20061112132849/http://www.uptownmag.com/archive/music/04sept09.htm |archivedate = 2006-11-12}}</ref> The song soon caught the music industry's attention and the band was signed to [[604 Records|604 Records/Universal]] in August 2002.<ref name="shadow">{{cite web | url = http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/T/Tin_Foil_Phoenix/AlbumReviews/2004/09/10/772034.html | title = Living in the Shadow of the Bat | author = Darryl Sterdan | publisher = Winnipeg Sun | accessdate = 2007-03-07}}</ref> The deal guaranteed the release of their debut album in the [[United States]], [[Canada]], the [[United Kingdom]], [[Australia]], [[Germany]], [[Belgium]], [[Luxembourg]] and the [[Netherlands]]. In February 2002, the name of the band changed from Sonic Bloom to Tin Foil Phoenix because of legal concerns over the name expressed by their international label affiliate, [[Roadrunner Records]]. Their first full-length album, ''[[Living In The Shadow Of The Bat]]'', was released on September 14, 2004 by 604/Universal. They have a new single called 'Have A Nice Day' on their MySpace and their second album ''Age Of Vipers'' is set for release on 20 May. The lead single of ''Age Of Vipers'' is called "Hurry Home". == Members == === Current === * '''Michael Allen Zirk''' - vocals * '''Fish''' - guitar * '''Phil Cholosky''' - guitar * '''Yves Gagnon''' - bass * '''Lyle Geisbrecht''' - Percussion. === Former === * '''Paul Robinson''' - bass * '''Stephen Kray''' - Percussion == Discography == ===Albums=== * ''[[Hurry (EP)|Hurry]]'' (EP, 2001) - released as Sonic Bloom * ''[[Living In The Shadow Of The Bat]]'' (2004) * ''[[Age of Vipers]]'' (2007) ===Singles=== * "Neopolitan" (2002, re-released 2004) * "Ms Genova" (2005) * "Have A Nice Day" (2007) (online only) * "Hurry Home" (2007) * "Not How The West Was Won" (2007) * "Man Of Constant Sorrow" (2008) ==In media== * Their hit song Ms. Genova is featured in the new [[IPod Nano]]'s music trivia. * The song "The Stuff" was included on the game soundtrack of [[2K Sports]]' [[NHL 2K10]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.2ksports.com/beats/games/nhl2k10|title=2K Beats: NHL 2K10|work=[[2K Sports]]|accessdate=2013-03-04|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20121119095513/http://2ksports.com/beats/games/nhl2k10|archivedate=2012-11-19}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.tinfoilphoenix.com/ Official Tin Foil Phoenix] official website * [http://www.c4records.ca c4records] * [http://umusic.ca/tinfoilphoenix/ Tin Foil Phoenix] Universal Music {{DEFAULTSORT:Tin Foil Phoenix}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 1997]] [[Category:Musical groups from Winnipeg]] [[Category:Canadian post-grunge groups]]
